summary: The IRS estimates that would-be thieves used false identities to try to steal $14.5 billion in refunds in the 2015 tax year. To address this high risk area, the IRS launched a pilot initiative in 2017 to help it, states, and tax industry members quickly share information. So far, 31 states and 17 industry groups are participating. We reviewed this effort and assessed how well...
title: Identity Theft: Improved Collaboration Could Increase Success of IRS Initiatives to Prevent Refund Fraud
